attributes.action: Give England its own National Anthem
attributes.background:
Wales, Scotland, and Ireland have their own National Anthems.  In fact, all our neighbours do, but not us, not England.  
During England's football match, the Welsh were able to sing their proud and stirring Welsh National Anthem, but they also sang ours, because it belongs to the UK, not England.
attributes.additional_details:
A National Anthem is about identity, which is particularly important during major sporting fixtures, as well as any public fixtures and competitions between the countries of the United Kingdom.

England is too often left behind, and it is surely time, that in common with her neighbours, she has a National Anthem which is her own.  I want to petition Parliament to consider my proposal, and I suggest 'Land of Hope and Glory' as something everyone can get behind.

Please consider supporting this.

attributes.action: Grant British citizenship to all settled EU nationals in UK
attributes.background: Most EU nationals who are setteled in UK, made UK their home, have mortgages, pay taxes and their kids attend schools across Britain are feared that after UK left EU their right to live and work in UK will be ceased and this will have a detremental impact on their life!

attributes.action: Condemn the Xenophobia of UK Tabloids and Ensure EU Free Movement Continues.
attributes.background: We call on MPs to condemn incitement by our tabloid press against foreigners and enact laws making it an offence. We call for a relationship with Europe that allows free movement from the EU so talented business people, scientists, academics, skilled workers & engineers feel welcome & not hated.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/jul/11/police-blame-worst-rise-in-recorded-hate-on-eu-referendum. 
http://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=50675#.V4YqavkrLmE
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/brexit-britain-latest-news-academics-threaten-to-quit-brain-drain-over-racist-xenophobic-eu-a7133316.html
http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/brexitvote/2016/06/29/letter-to-mps-from-a-remain-voter-a-plea-for-realism-tolerance-and-honesty/
http://nyti.ms/29H7OnH

attributes.action: Introduce a jury system so family's fighting forced adoption have a fair trial
attributes.background: Fighting social services on forced adoption, give families a fair say and the options to explore every solution on earth to make changes to keep families together.
attributes.additional_details: Adoption is so final and social services play God with children's lives forced adoption is barbaric

attributes.action: Women and Equalitiy Committee to conduct a full review of the TransInquiry
attributes.background: The Women and Equalities Commision published the Transgender Equality Report on the 7th July 2016. It does not address any of the main concerned of Transgended Men and Women in the UK. It pastes over cracks in the systems, law and the rights of Trans people. Our community demands a full review.
attributes.additional_details: There are 35 recommendations writhin the report and the majority are incomplete. The Transgender community requires that a further review is taken to ensure that the Women and Equalities Commision continue the work that have done to fully address all 35 recommendations and too ensure all are fully addressed in the shortest possible timeframe. This report must be treated as an interim report that is a work in progress. We demand the right to appropriate treatment and complete self determination.

attributes.action: Call a General Election in 2017.  Brexit needs a plan with an electoral mandate.
attributes.background:
A referendum vote to leave and "take our freedom back" is not a plan - its a protest. We need a plan on how we leave and what we do next.
This plan should have an electoral mandate from us all - Brexiteers and Remainers alike. 
That is the only way to can build a new unity and a strong future.
attributes.additional_details:
We need three things ASAP:
1. The parties (old guard, and maybe new?) should propose their Brexit plan. 
2. A General Election should be called soon - ideally Spring 2017.
3. The plan people want most will receive a proper mandate.
We can make something good happen. We will have to look beyond our party allegiances to do so. Please get stuck in. Share, like, petition, .... or come up with something better than this.

attributes.action: Create an offence of making knowingly or recklessly false claims in elections
attributes.background: The EU Referendum on the continuing membership of the EU has highlighted the use of clear untruths and other misleading comments.  Voters have suggested they would have voted differently if they had known the truth.  There should be criminal liability for such activity to prevent it reoccurring.
attributes.additional_details:
The Leave campaign claimed that Â£350M per week would be released to be spent on the NHS.  This claim was stated to be false by "Leave" within days of the vote.

Individuals who make false statements to the state (for example in relation to benefits) risk being prosecuted, whilst politicians are not censured for false statements to the people.  We believe that a separate offence of knowingly or recklessly making false statements or misleading the public in relation to elections is required.

attributes.action: Any new Prime Minister must have the confidence of the people and Parliament
attributes.background: We call for the Fixed-term Parliaments Act to be amended such that any new Prime Ministerâs government must face an explicit vote of confidence in the Commons. If no government can win such a vote, a general election must be held.
attributes.additional_details:
After the EU Referendum result and the Prime Ministerâs resignation, Parliament must show confidence in the Government or call a general election.

 The Government and any new Prime Minister have no mandate for post-referendum negotiations. The exceptional circumstances and political division require a new mandate.

 Petitions cannot call for a vote of No Confidence, nor for the dissolution of Parliament, but they can ask for an amendment to legislation such as the Fixed-term Parliaments Act.

attributes.action: Stop the UK Government leaving the EU without consent from Scottish Parliament.
attributes.background:
Brexit politicians misled millions of voters on immigration, funding, the NHS, and the economic impact of leaving the EU.

We the undersigned call on David Cameron and Nicola Sturgeon to ensure the views of the Scottish people are represented and cease the process of leading the UK out of the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Scotland has to agree to the UK leaving the EU in order for Brexit to go ahead. A second referendum is extremely unlikely. The best chance we have of stopping the UK proceeding with leaving the EU is for the Scottish Parliament to refuse to give formal legislative consent.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on London becoming independent from the UK
attributes.background:
London is the world's capital. 300+ languages are spoken here. Immigrants are welcome, and are vital to our economy.

We voted decisively to stay in the EU. Our global outlook sets us apart from the rest of England.

London's population is 8.5m â Scotland's is 5.3m.

Independence makes sense.
attributes.additional_details: Specifics: If you live within the M25, you get a vote âÂ just like in the Scottish referendum. It doesn't matter if you're a British citizen or not. If you don't live within the M25, you don't get a vote.

attributes.action: Call a general election in the next 90 days as a result of the EU vote.
attributes.background: This vote should never have been called and as a result the population of the United Kingdom has no confidence in the leadership of the government. We demand a general election in the next 90 days to elect new leaders to help manage this emerging crisis.

attributes.action: Stop permission to build Branston Road School Academy on current proposed site
attributes.background: Vital arable land will be lost. Hedgerow vital to wildlife will be destroyed. Applicant, Planning Authority & Education Authority are one and the same! Surrounding villages were promised green barrier and then this was permitted! Villages not designed to cope with current traffic without school.
attributes.additional_details: Tatenhill Parish Councillors can be contacted for further info.  Burton Mail also has articles referencing objections.

attributes.action: Dogs to be kept on leads whilst on sports fields
attributes.background:
On ongoing issue in our society is dog walkers allowing their dogs to run freely over sporting pitches, i.e rugby, football, cricket...
At times these dogs will release on the pitches and owners will ignore the excrement and not pick it up, thus providing a huge risk to those who play on them
attributes.additional_details:
Sporting pitches experience usage from a variety of different people - the problem of dog walkers allowing their dogs to be off their lead is that they are free to excrement wherever, the majority of the time, without the owner knowing.
The danger of this on sporting pitches is that it increases the risk of a child or adult getting the faeces in their eyes leading to several physical and health risks such as going blind.

Please help stop this and provide some respect for our sportsman.

attributes.action: Debate Autism and Employment
attributes.background: As somebody on the Autism Spectrum I currently claim Jobseeker's Allowance and I feel that I have not been given any support to look for a job and they don't understand Autism or how to help people like me to get into employment.
attributes.additional_details: There needs to be people trained in Autism within the DWP as the advisors I have seen do not seem to understand people like me at all, this leads to me feeling very emotional and stressed out, and I dread attending the jobcentre as I really dislike being there, you literally get 5 minutes to be seen then your out the door.

attributes.action: Double the free child care hours for working parents or single working parent.
attributes.background:
More than one in four UK business leaders say employees have cut their hours because of the "high cost of childcare", a report from the British Chambers of Commerce says.

The government wants to have a lower unemployment rate, so they should consider things like this.
attributes.additional_details: UK jobless rate declined to 4.8 percent in the three months to September 2016 from 4.9 percent in the April to June period and 5.3 percent a year earlier. This could be changed if they helped us with child care costs!

attributes.action: Make it illegal to walk a dog in a public place without a lead on
attributes.background: I am seeing a lot of dog attacks lately that could have been avoided if the dog was on a lead. I think it should be the law that all dogs are on a lead in a public place

attributes.action: Restrict the usage of fireworks to a 2 hour time slot (6-8pm or 7-9pm)
attributes.background: The law in the UK currently states that you may not set off fireworks between 11pm and 7am, except for Diwali, New Year and Chinese New Year, when it's 1am. Requesting a change from these hours to a reasonable 2 hour time slot will help people with young families and pets during this time.
attributes.additional_details:
Built up areas/residential areas: The sound of multiple displays up until 11pm/1am can be deafening as the bangs reverberate off buildings and wake sleeping children/stress out pets.
Fireworks have a 120 db sound limit: This is the same as a thunderclap. With multiple fireworks going off simultaneously and sounding like a thunderstorm for up to 5/7 hours straight, this can be extremely frightening for young children, babies and pets, as well as the elderly and any servicemen and women with PTSD.

attributes.action: Stop schools from giving awards for 100% attendance.
attributes.background: Schools often issue awards for children who attain 100% attendance. Apart from the fact that this discriminates against many children who have medical appointments which cannot be arranged out of term time, absence from school for certain illnesses is required, making 100% attendance impossible.
attributes.additional_details: Many of the childhood illnesses children contract are caught from their classmates, at school. Many of these illnesses, such as chicken pox, rotavirus and impetigo, require children to be absent from school for a minimum period of time before returning. This means the 100% attendance award is an impossibility and awarding it to children who have somehow managed not to suffer from these illnesses throughout the school year makes other children feel inadequate. It's discriminatory and must stop.

attributes.action: Establish Hallowe'en  (31st October) as an annual national statutory holiday.
attributes.background: Hallowe'en has grown in popularity in the UK as a non-religious, community event.  This celebration encourages creativity as children make costumes & characters. Trick-or-treating encourages people to get out into their neighbourhoods and enjoy a home-made, creative festival together.
attributes.additional_details:
There are no other autumn holidays in the UK and would occur at a midpoint between the August Bank Holiday and Christmas. 
2. The historic origins of Hallowe'en are outlined on the Historic UK: http://www.historic-uk.com/CultureUK/Halloween/
3. This link which outlines some risks and debunks some unfounded fears. http://content.time.com/time/nation/article/0,8599,1933329,00.html .  This holiday could promote safe driving to enable children be safe outside at all times of year.

attributes.action: Tax on Premier League transfers to install and maintain free to use 4G pitches.
attributes.background: Introduce a tax on all Premier league transfers to raise funds to install and maintain 4G pitches in as many towns in England/Wales as possible that are free for kids/sports clubs/schools etc to use. Many children throughout England and Wales have to play football on inadequate pitches.
attributes.additional_details: Many football pitches are (water logged/on a hill/dangerous/ridden with dog muck) despite there being record breaking amounts of money in the English Premier league. Â£1.165bn spent to date this season already. Health of kids would increase from these pitches as would anti-social behaviour in communities. National football team would benefit as more children given opportunity to play on 'fit for purpose' pitches and fulfill their potential.

attributes.action: Introduce LGBT relationship education, similar to heterosexual relationships.
attributes.background: If we introduce LGBT education from a young age, we are more likely to rid the country of the stigma that still affects young people, and causes bullying and harm throughout our society. Educating people will almost definitely reduce the ignorance that causes homophobia.

attributes.action: Give drink drivers an instant 4 week jail sentence if convicted to deter them.
attributes.background: In 2014 stats show that some 220 people were killed in crashes in which a driver was over the legal limit, 880 were seriously injured. Nearly 1 in 6 of all deaths on the road involve drivers who are over the legal alcohol limit. This is still too high and people still think it's OK to drink-drive.
attributes.additional_details: A total of 613,090 people were charged with drink driving during this period. 2004 - 2014. Statistics show that 595,093 (97%) of defendants charged were subsequently convicted while 17,997 (97%) were not convicted. Taken from drink driving.org

attributes.action: Ban Kirpans (ceremonial dagger) in primary schools
attributes.background: My children's primary school has just announced that they have passed a policy allowing children (aged 4 upwards) to wear a Kirpan if they have taken promises under Amrit. Â
attributes.additional_details: To me, a dagger is a dagger and has absolutely no place in a primary school. Â I would like to see the Goverment review the situation and bring a complete ban on Kirpans in primary schools, as despite theÂ policies in place, I do not feel happy allowing my children to be in an environment where other children are carrying daggers or knives.

attributes.action: Move the Houses of Parliament to Birmingham.
attributes.background: Houses of Parliament restoration work is estimated to cost Â£4 billion. We propose a new building on the outskirts of Birmingham near to the Airport and Exhibition Centre. A geographically central home in our second city would be created for Parliament and would provide excellent transport links.

attributes.action: Government to Stop using private enterprise caterer and return military cooks
attributes.background: At present the services use private enterprise caterer such as Sodexo Catering Services. and the standard of food provided is not to a suitable standards.  and as the cost is increasing this situation should be rectified
attributes.additional_details: As members of the services are on a compulsory pay to dine scheme and it would appear their complaints are ignored. the government must take action.  The services have to have catering staff for service in areas of hostility these should also be in charge af army cook houses

attributes.action: Incentivise broadband providers, only pay for the broad band you get
attributes.background: Provider use the phrase âup toâ so there is no incentive for them to improve the speed or systems to provide what you are paying for.  e.g  speed quoted at 20 Mbs and you get 10 Mbs then you would only pay half the cost and so on. Providers would then need to tell the truth on broad band speeds.

attributes.action: Make Counselling and Psychotherapy a professional qualification.
attributes.background:
Anyone is able to set up in private practice and call themselves a Counsellor or Psychotherapist.
I would like a minimum qualification that is recognised by a regulatory body, such as the BACP, to benchmark a qualification to prevent poorly trained or unqualified individuals from practising.

attributes.action: Legalise civil partnerships for heterosexual couples
attributes.background: Everyone, whether heterosexual, homosexual, or bisexual, should have the option of entering into either a marriage, or a civil partnership.

attributes.action: Keep the United Kingdom inside the European Economic Area (EEA) and rejoin EFTA.
attributes.background:
-A supermajority of young people voted to remain inside the European Union
-We now know the consequences truly of voting to leave and Article 50 hasn't yet been triggered.
-Hundreds of thousands if not millions of Leave voters regret their decision
attributes.additional_details: We the undersigned pledge our support for the United Kingdom remaining a part of the EEA, which includes the EU alongside Iceland, Liechtenstein, and Norway. We pledge our support for rejoining the European Free Trade Agreement, which we established in 1960 and led until 1973. EEA member countries outside the EU participate in its single market but can also negotiate trade agreements freely and independently. We the British people would also continue to have de facto European Union citizenship.

attributes.action: Ensure all future national referendums need more than 50% of electorate to pass
attributes.background: 37% of the electorate took the decision for UK to leave the EU. I believe this to be anti-democratic.
attributes.additional_details:
A minority of the electorate should not be able to take the country in a new direction. 

If an issue is so important it requires a national  referendum,  then to change the status quo it should be able to get more than 50% of the entire electorate,  regardless of turnout. If it cannot get 50% of the entire electorate it should be deemed to have failed.

attributes.action: Give the right to vote to EU citizens having lived in the UK for 5 years or more
attributes.background: EU residents, who have lived in the UK for 5 years or more, have the right to get UK citizenship. However many people do not exercise this option for various reasons and, consequently, they do not have the right to vote. Brexit referendum has shown risks deriving from the lack of this voting right
attributes.additional_details: EU residents are net contributors to the UK economy and represent a crucial asset for the sustainable development of this country. Giving voting rights to EU residents who have lived in the UK for 5 years or more would mean the recognition of a fair right and would allow EU residents to have their say on topics that have a direct impact on their lives (such as the recent EU referendum)

attributes.action: Give weapons to Ukraine to defend herself from Russian hybrid war
attributes.background: The level of Russian aggression is rising just as our once formidable ability (back in the cold war ) to counter them seems to have vanished altogether. Instead, we have trouble simply recognizing them for what they are.
attributes.additional_details: Ukraine gave up its nuclear weapons in exchange for the grantee from the United Kingdom that they will protect the Ukrainian nation from invasion. The Budapest Memorandum on Security Assurances signed in Budapest, Hungary on 5 December 1994, providing security assurances by its signatories relating to Ukraine's accession to the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons. The Memorandum was signed by USA and the United Kingdom..  It is time to honor the spirit of the agreement..

attributes.action: figures/statistics quoted in political campaigns should be official&independent
attributes.background:
Regardless of ones politics, bogus financial/figures and claims are put forward.

To restore faith in politics and so people can make an informed decision, all facts/statistics should be from a central source, who verify statistics for use.

Deviation from this should be made an offence.

attributes.action: Allow immigrants to vote in UK national elections and referendums.
attributes.background: The scapegoating of immigrants during political campaigns narrows the debate, hides the true reasons for economic problems, and distorts the result. If immigrants were granted the vote, as they are in local elections, they would not be targeted in this way.
attributes.additional_details: During the 18 September 2014 referendum on Scottish independence, all EU and Commonwealth citizens resident in Scotland aged 16 or over could vote. During the 23rd June 2016 referendum on the UK's membership of the EU, immigrants from the EU were not allowed to vote, though commonwealth citizens were. The campaign focussed unduly on the issue of immigration to the detriment of other important issues.

attributes.action: Veto Turkey joining the EU until they cease their illegal occupation of Cyprus
attributes.background: In July 1974, Turkish forces twice invaded and captured the island of Cyprus and now illegally occupy 40% of it. Cyprus is a member of the EU and Turkey wish to join. Countries that occupy member states illegally cannot join the EU but Turkey will be allowed to unless it is vetoed.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkish_invasion_of_Cyprus

attributes.action: More NHS funding in mental health for armed forces veterans suffering with PTSD.
attributes.background: Many armed forces veterans are faced with harrowing and distressing circumstances in the line of duty.Organisations such as Salute in Burnley Lancashire provide support and counselling to Lancashire armed forces Veterans and are not funded appropriately.Veterans need our support.
attributes.additional_details: Services such as Salute in Burnley Lancashire provide support and counselling for armed forces veterans.In order to survive they need to be funded appropriately.This year they were given Â£20,000 less than the previous year and yet have a greater demand and an expanding waiting list.The demand for these services is high and the funding is lacking.Support our brave soldiers in the aftercare they deserve.

attributes.action: Subsidise Care Fees for the elderly by using money from  Overseas Aid.
attributes.background: Why should the elderly have to sell their homes to fund their care when billions are spent, much of it wasted, on foreign aid.  Surely we should look after our own first, before borrowing money to spend on foreigners.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for rail fares to rise without inflation and improved services
attributes.background: Every year the public has to pay more to travel on a train network that is not contributing back to the paying customers who along with businesses rely on the efficient running of the railway, delays cancellations and strikes are increasing in number and action needs to be taken rapidly.

attributes.action: Make physical appearance a protected characteristic.
attributes.background: People feel victimised by an unjust decision to restrict their identity. Having their own hair style and colour makes people feel more comfortable in society, this can make people feel more comfortable with themselves. This should be accepted to give everyone an equal opportunity to be themselves.
attributes.additional_details: In schools, teachers try to dictate hair colour and style. Article 10 of the Human Rights Act states that students should be able to express themselves and make them feel identified without the interference from the authority (teachers being the authority in schools). Also, the same idea applies in article 14. This article was created to try and allow everyone to have equal opportunities for something they may otherwise be judged upon. So why doesn't Article 14 protect physical appearance? All other protected characteristics are things that make people feel more accepted in society because in the past they were not as widely accepted. People should not change the way they look from a style that makes them feel comfortable with themselves, so don't make them.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to desecrate National flags or symbols of National importance
attributes.background: Recent events such as the burning of poppies during the remembrance parades have caused anger and division in our society.  Such acts are offensive to the majority of UK citizens and are completely unacceptable in a civilised society such as ours.
attributes.additional_details: The burning or desecration of any of the UK National flags is deeply offensive to a large majority of UK citizens as is burning or destroying of poppies during the period when such symbols are worn to honour the fallen.  We, the petitioners demand that such acts be classed as hate crimes and that the offenders be prosecuted accordingly under the appropriate legislation.

attributes.action: Continue the Rail Electrification Works between Cardiff and London via Bristol
attributes.background:
On 8th November, it has been reported that electrification works on the railways between Cardiff and London via Bristol, among other works, will be arbitrarily and indefinitely delayed from the previous schedule.

This is an insult to the people of Bristol, Wales and the South West.
attributes.additional_details:
"Costly and disruptive electrification works" have already been underway in Bristol and the Severn Tunnel. To delay capitalizing on the progress that has already been made is to ask the region to absorb the economic penalties from those works without view of payback in improved service.

We urge the minister Paul Maynard to honour his party's manifesto pledge, reconsider this decision and continue with the works as planned.

https://goo.gl/IpVbRY

https://goo.gl/osNOoe

attributes.action: Allow young people with 'controlled/managed' Asthma to join the Army.
attributes.background: Thousands of honest, dedicated young people have been denied recruitment to the Army simply for being diagnosed Asthmatic. Many young people who are physically fit and mentally capable are still being unfairly refused enrolment for receiving preventative treatment which keeps Asthma symptoms at bay
attributes.additional_details: Asthma is a life long condition that in many cases can be controlled/managed to the point where the sufferers symptoms have no effect on their daily life and activities. Thousands of young people are being unfairly denied the chance to defend their country and build themselves a solid and secure future simply because they receive preventative medication which keeps their Asthma symptoms at bay. This is unfair and outdated!

attributes.action: Raise teachers' pay
attributes.background: Teachers are the backbone of society and there would be no future without them. Yet they so undervalued and undermined within society and do not receive a high enough wage.

attributes.action: Raise awareness and put more funding into treating and diagnosing VGM.
attributes.background: My little boy was repeatedly failed by numerous of consultants, doctors and hospitals after being diagnosed with Vein of Galen malformation. This was purely due to the lack of knowledge and understanding of the condition. We're counting our lucky stars he finally got treatment before it was too late
attributes.additional_details:
This condition is deadly. A ticking time bomb in your head. It's diagnosed in pregnancy and is where a mass forms in the brain putting strain on the heart to provide this mass with more blood. So many children die because either because it's too late to treat them or because of complications. 
This needs to stop! 
I nearly lost my little boy and I won't sit and watch it happen to any other parent. 
Money needs to be invested in helping doctors diagnose and treat children before it's too late.

attributes.action: Stop BT having the monopoly on installing phone lines so other providers can.
attributes.background: As consumers in this day and age we should be able to have options to use a company for a service or not. BT have not been able to provide myself and others on the estate with a phone line or internet services, myself since June 2016 others longer than 8 months
attributes.additional_details: some of the residents including myself on the estate have gone down the complaints route to the CEO and it's still not been resolved and no foreseeable dates for a resolution either. Only BT install phone lines then rent them to other providers. There is literally nothing any of us have been able to do. Every week we chase for an update to be told it's still being looked at. No dates no resolution and no phone line and Internet

attributes.action: Review cases of women needing breast reduction on medical grounds, not cosmetic
attributes.background:
Many women are being refused breast reduction on NHS because it is primarily seen as cosmetic. Funding has been withdrawn in many areas of the UK. 
Many of these women are suffering long term health problems and being denied treatment that would lead to a better quality of life
attributes.additional_details:
Cosmetic surgery is performed to enhance the patients appearance and this type of surgery obviously has its place. 
However, many women are being refused breast reduction on the basis that it is, primarily, acknowledged as a cosmetic procedure. 
Women are suffering chronic backache, which at times can prove crippling, neck pain, shoulder pain, headaches and breast abscesses, to name but a few ailments. 
Referrals to a surgeon are difficult, if not impossible in some areas, due to lack of funding

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people with Crohns, Ulcerative Colitis
attributes.background: I suffer with this and I have to pay Â£104 a year for medication and that's with a prepayment prescription card. I can't live without this medication and I can get extremely poorly to the point hospital is required. I think this should be made free.

attributes.action: To cease Brexit negotiations until there is a drop in racially motivated crimes.
attributes.background: Racially motivated crimes appear to have increased in this country. The Government need to halt all Brexit negotiations until there is a substantial drop in racial and xenophobic hate crimes and issue an immediate statement of 'zero tolerance'

attributes.action: Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.background:
This year marks 34 years since the Falklands War. 
The invasion of the Falkland Islands occurred April 2 1982. 
The conflict ended June 14 1982. 
We believe that to mark our Armed Forces bravery and sacrifice, this date should be known as Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that the Government should mark the liberation of the Falkland Islands and name June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.
To mark our brave Armed Forces' bravery, courage and sacrifice, we believe  this should be officially recognised.
The Falklands Islands mark Margaret Thatcher Day every year. They have the right to self determination.
It is now time to mark this in our own calendar.
Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.

attributes.action: Companies get tax benefits to sell recycled tech or parts rather than new tech
attributes.background: Every year, millions of tons of operational tech is thrown away. For example in Europe, the average phone is used for 1.5yrs before being swapped, but most actually last ~6yrs. If the tax system were changed, companies would be encouraged to promote reuse or recycling of old technology.
attributes.additional_details:
See
http://www.electronicstakeback.com/wp-content/uploads/Facts-and-Figures-on-E-Waste-and-Recycling.pdf
